Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

n, m: nat

m + S n = S n + m

Qed.```

- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

intros h net ps client id c out d l p t v Hhandle Hps.
destruct Hhandle as [out_eq d_eq l_eq].
rewrite out_eq in *. rewrite d_eq in *. rewrite l_eq in *.
destruct (Hps p) as [Hin_nwPackets | Hin_send_packets].
- apply In_In_nth_error in Hin_nwPackets.
  destruct Hin_nwPackets as [n Hin_nwPackets].
  exists n. split; eauto.
- destruct Hin_send_packets as [m [Hin_l Hm_eq]].
  exists (length l - S m). split; eauto.
Qed.
